meanings.definition: A name that describes someone's position or job.
meanings.sent1: In the company, the manager holds the titles of both supervisor and team leader.
meanings.sent2: The title 'doctor' is given to someone who has completed medical school.
meanings.sent3: The cat proudly wore the titles of 'King of the Couch' and 'Master of Mice'.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness earned her the title of 'Queen of Hearts' among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The title 'President' carries a lot of responsibility and authority.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase that appears at the beginning of a book, chapter, etc.
meanings.sent1: The titles of the chapters in the book helped the reader understand the content.
meanings.sent2: The title of the novel 'Pride and Prejudice' hints at the themes explored in the story.
meanings.sent3: The titles of the chapters whispered a secret message when read in order.
meanings.sent4: The title of the book was like a door that invited readers into a new world.
meanings.sent5: The title 'The Great Gatsby' evokes images of glamour and mystery.

meanings.definition: A formal document that proves ownership of property.
meanings.sent1: He kept the titles to his house in a safe deposit box at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer reviewed the titles to ensure the property transfer was legal.
meanings.sent3: The titles to the land were locked away in a hidden drawer for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The titles to the estate were like keys to a kingdom passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The title deed is a crucial document when buying or selling a property.
